name: places/ChIJP5QIMO_3wokRCeckEAlzjp0
adrFormatAddress: 1882 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA

editorialSummary.text: Longtime chain serving a variety of donut flavors & shapes, plus coffee & frozen drinks.

originalText.text: KRISPY KREAM!! What can we say but YESSSSS!!! This store just opened today on 104th st and 3rd Avenue to much delight from the surrounding residents who live in this community. I have had the pleasure of being invited to the “NSO” (New Store Opening) ahead of the grand opening day as a VIP member joining through the KRISPY KREAM app. They have invited me to a couple of store openings, which I taught was an excellent  “Perk” for signing up. The ladies who are in charge of doing these roll outs are a excellent group. I have congratulated them twice on lo the new locations and have inquired about becoming a “Franchise Owner”, but unfortunately at this time the company is not offering this opportunity. Regardless these donuts are some of the best in Town! Go get check it if your in the neighborhood, you can get your delicious Donut fix with no complaints. Welcome to Spanish Harlem.

originalText.text: I was walking by Krispy Kreme and decided to enter.I haven’t frequented this place in a while. I asked the young man behind the counter,” what time do you close?” He replied,” in 5 minutes.” I stated,” I made it just in time.” Anyway I purchased a dozen donuts and asked for the senior discount and they didn’t believe me when I told them my age. Long story short, I got the senior discount and happily started walking home. From behind me I heard a female voice calling mister. When I turned around it was the girl from Krispy Kreme who sold me the donuts. She ran after me because I left my debit card in the card machine. Her name is Nadia and I want to acknowledge her integrity and willingness to seek me out after I left the store. Big ups to Nadia!!

originalText.text: Closed now, seems permanently. Last summer, the employee I spoke to to claim my birthday reward (with the app) was very nice and gave me no trouble. This summer, at the site down on 86th/Lexington, the employee did not honor the reward, despite me showing the proof on my phone. The store did not update the system from the old reward to the new type of reward. Don't go to the aforementioned one. Bad service.

originalText.text: Taking into account a current 4,7 star rating, this place unfortunately could not live up to its expectation. Poor service, very limited product choice, poor experience. It is a donut place, but there are only 2 different kinds of donuts with filling - and the taste was very average.

originalText.text: Thank God they came back to NY Duncan donuts sucks. A fried donut is better than a baked donut and Krispy Kreme fries theirs. All donuts are not the same. You be the judge. Enjoy ⚓️
